messages.title: IMPORTANT MEETING - ALL WELCOME
messages.content: Thursday May 18th, 7.30pm at St George’s Church, Kemptown. Come and find out why we are putting aside tribal party politics to JOIN TOGETHER to defeat the Conservatives.

messages.title: KICKSTARTING PROGRESSIVE POLITICS
messages.content: GREEN PARTY WITHDRAWS PARLIAMENTARY CANDIDATE IN BRIGHTON KEMPTOWN TO LAUNCH PROGRESSIVE POLITICS IN BRIGHTON.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Protect our local schools such as Moulsecoomb Primary School which loses £823 per pupil under the Tories.
Help reduce homelessness; our city has the highest levels in the UK - outside London - one in 69 people.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Elected with a majority of only 690 votes. For this election only, the Greens have made a tactical decision to avoid splitting the progressive vote in Kemptown and will not be standing in the constituency.

issues.brexitEurope: Give you a say over Brexit
issues.education: Stop grammar schools, and schools' funding cuts
issues.environment: Protect the environment and tackle climate change
issues.health: Save the NHS from cuts and privatisation
issues.socialWelfare: End growing inequality between the 'haves' and 'have nots'

quotes.text: People who have spent years campaigning in our city took the decision to put aside party allegiances and work together so we have the best possible chance of delivering a fair voting system and beating the Tories on 8 June. These choices were not easy, indeed they are acts of political bravery.

images.caption: Caroline Lucas, Co-Leader of the Green Party with the Green Party’s Davy Jones.
